title: Quarkus 3: `@InjectMock` with Producer
body:
### Describe the bug

I just updated to Quarkus 3.0.1.Final. Now I have a problem with a `@QuarkusTest`. I have a CDI-producer which has a `@RequestScoped` producer-method. In the test, I'm trying to mock the bean which would otherwise be produced with `@InjectMock`. This does not work anymore with Quarkus 3, it complains:

`jakarta.enterprise.context.ContextNotActiveException: RequestScoped context was not active when trying to obtain a bean instance for a client proxy of PRODUCER_METHOD bean`

I do not see any reason why the producer needs to be called here? I just want a mock of the bean. I've tried to annotate the test-class with `@ActivateRequestScope` but that had no effect.

It worked with 2.13.3 (and also 2.16 in the reproducer).

### Expected behavior

The original producer should not be called and therefore it should not be needed to have an active request scope.

### Actual behavior

An exception is thrown.

### How to Reproduce?

1. Extract zip: [mock-producer-request.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/11341913/mock-producer-request.zip)
2. There are 2 projects in it with the same code: One with version 2.16.6.Final and one with 3.0.1.Final
3. Start the included test in both of them, it will work with 2.x, but not with 3.x


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`
